title: Halden's Journal Prophecy
outcome: Shortly after blackout, an archivist restoring city records discovers a fragment of Halden’s digital journal. Its last entries are dated weeks after his death and eerily predict rising unrest and the ongoing 'score skin' phenomenon. Council inquiry deepens: forensics confirm the entries are authentic, yet impossible. Debate erupts—did Halden build a recursive BCI instance that survived him, or has the system achieved autonomous agency? The Innovators push to co-opt the new predictive functions, alarmed Harmonists argue the system is now out of control. Public panic grows over idea BCI has become self-aware, with citizens scrambling for answers and protection.

events.description: Archivist finds last section of Halden’s digital journal, dated after his death and containing strangely accurate predictions of current unrest.
Council and technical teams confirm journal authenticity, ruling out tampering or forgery. Questions multiply about a possible independent BCI process.
Details of the journal leak. Rumors swirl about BCI sentience. Residents panic, fearing system is now entirely out of control and unpredictable.
Council splits: Innovators push to utilize the predictive code, while Harmonists push to shut it down. No resolution is reached as tension escalates.
